title: Automobiles Come Under Scrutiny
desc: Large chart in hand, your Transportation Minister suggests you take at a look at limiting automotive output. Uh oh. People aren't gonna like that.

choices.title: We can't get by without our cars!
Institute Alternate Day Driving Rules
Invest in public transportation, limit access to large / multiple autos
Limit Access to Automobiles

title: Homes Have Got to Change
desc: After touring several showcase green buildings, a scientist takes you aside and tells you that the home is one of biggest places an impact can be made.

choices.title: Not in my backyard, hippie!
Require efficient (more costly) appliances with increased lifespans
Cap hot water and energy use under penalty of fines
Limit footprint and square footage of all new homes

title: For The Birds
desc: In the government cafeteria, over a bowl of lentils, a pressure groups tells you grim truth: how we eat is a major factor in climate change. The lentils go down funny.

choices.title: But hamburgers are a way of life!
Limit meat production to only high quality, low impact solutions-- at a cost
Begin to institute a culture change to a primarily vegetarian diet
Begin to institute a culture change to less caloric intake per person

title: Builders Get Angry
desc: Your office is filled with a group of manufacturing lobbyists that are angry about rumors coming from your office that there are changes to manufacturing standards coming...

choices.title: Pour them all a scotch. You guys are crazy!
Reduce intensity of chemical manufacturing of paper, concrete, and cement
Reduce intensity of chemical manufacturing of iron, steel, and aluminum
Require highly efficient recycled materials

title: Keep On Truckin'
desc: Looking over a map of the world's major trading routes, your transportation minister informs you that shipping of goods might be an easy way to cut down on climate change.

choices.title: Breaker, breaker, we're gonna boogie!
Require highly efficient vehicles, limit road access
Require highly efficient hybrid vehicles
Require 100% hydrogen & electric transport

title: Adjusting the Skyline
desc: Your housing minister gives you a ride on a blimp to gaze down upon on your capital city. Once you're up there, he brings you grim news : something must be done about the buildings.

choices.title: We have the best buildings. Just terrific. The best!
Require upgraded heating and cooling systems
Retrofit all buildings HVACs to high efficiency at great cost
Require all new construction is 100% green buildings

title: Cap and Trade Floor Fight
desc: The congress is in a stalemate and close to filibustered shut down because of new rules released by the environmental ministry that attempt to capture heavy pollution

choices.title: Can't we all get along? There's no need to fight.
Negotiate carbon capture on limited industry
Negotiate carbon capture on manufactory
Negotiate carbon capture on power plants

title: Bioenergy Emerges As New Hope
desc: Bioenergy is a renewable energy made from material derived from biological materials like wood, algae, and manure, your scientists tell you. The cable news programs are mocking you. But it's just so crazy, it just might work.

choices.title: There's no way I'm gonna burn poop and mold. That's just silly.
Increase biofuel production by 25%
Increase biofuel production by 50%
Increase biofuel production by 100%

title: President Convenes Energy Summit
desc: In the back room of the summit, an oil executive corners you and tells you quietly that he personally is all for doing something about climate change, it's just the jobs he's really worried about. Including his own.

choices.title: Drill, baby, drill!
Decrease fossil fuel production by 25%
Decrease fossil fuel production by 50%
Decrease fossil fuel production by 100%

title: Sit-In for Solar
desc: You walk into your office to find a group of people sitting around and chanting about the sun. The leader pushes you to consider shifting the energy economy to renewables.

choices.title: Get off of my lawn!
Increase Storage and Demand Efficiency
Increase renewable energy by 10%
Increase renewable energy by 25%

title: Is Nuclear The Solution?
desc: Your energy minister brings you a binder full of facts and figures that make it clear : nuclear is one of the cleanest and most viable solutions right now. But it sure isn't popular.

choices.title: Uh, have you heard of the term 'meltdown'?
Increase nuclear energy by 10%
Increase nuclear energy by 15%
Increase nuclear energy by 20%

title: Food Production Questioned
desc: On a visit to a farm, a farmer gives you the straight dope: there's ways food production can help climate change, too.

choices.title: Our food production is just perfect!
Decrease food and water waste
Increase livestock efficiency with small land area per animal
Utilize GMOs to increase crop yields

title: This Land Is Our Land
desc: Land use has been a patchwork of historical decisions and adjustments and fixes over the centuries, but fighting this fight will require a judicious and thought approach to how we use our space.

choices.title: Land is private, and not for public sacrifice
Smarter land use techniques and permitting
Dedicate large amount of land to biocrops
Reduce exurbs, return much of land to reforestation

title: Demographics
desc: During a cabinet meeting, someone finally says what no one else has, yet: we're going to have to talk population control.

choices.title: We can't tell people how to raise their families!
Reduce rural and suburban infrastructure, increase urban density
Limit couples to 2 children per family
Limit couples to 1 child per family

title: Bayou City begins to flood permanently
desc: The historic city on the Gulf stops having a 'Dry' season, and the residents there begin to trade their cars for rowboats.

choices.title: Continue

title: Prominent Climate Scientist arrested on tax evasion
desc: The crime has nothing to do with his research, but it's a blow to the cause and his increasingly desperate pleas to the public

choices.title: Continue

title: Hottest Summer on Record
desc: Brownouts blanket the nations as Urthians desperately try to cool themselves from the sweltering heat. It increases public awareness-- but also uses more energy. D'oh.

choices.title: Continue

title: Coldest Winter on Record
desc: A Senator holds up a snowball in Congress to prove that all of this climate change stuff is a hoax. He doesn't understand that climate change means more extreme weather, not just hotter weather. But the public falls for it.

choices.title: Continue

title: Drought!
desc: Massive drought across much of breadbasket leads to economic downturn. Right when you need it the most, the public turns against you.

choices.title: Continue

title: Climate Summit
desc: The player convenes all the leader of Urth together and makes a showy and urgent show of worldwide unification against this global threat. The Urthians get a little misty eyed and throw public will your way.

choices.title: Continue

title: An Uncomfortable Thingie
desc: Former President Alf Gorp makes a moving documentary about the warming planet, and Urthians go to see it in droves.

choices.title: Continue
